Position Overview The Assessment Nurse if the first person that the potential member/member and family meet from the MLTC & FIDA programs. The Assessment Nurse conducts the UAS assessment to determine the level of care needed to support applicants/members in the own homes. The incumbent will complete the UAS assessment tools and makes the determination if an applicant is appropriate for the MetroPlus MLTC program. The Assessment Nurse also completes the UAS assessment tool on members already enrolled in the MLTC & FIDA programs upon program enrollment, semi-annually and when there is a significant change in condition.Job DescriptionMeets with applicant, family and caregiver to determine if MLTC program applicants meet the clinical qualifications for enrollment. (i.e.; UAS score 5 or greater, needing 120 days of care, safe in home environment).Meet with member, family and caregiver to conduct the UAS tool for MLTC & FIDA program enrollees.Conducts all assessment needed based on UAS tool.Scores the Attendant Care Worker tasking tool and shares potential hours and daycare services with applicant and family.Discusses other for applicants that do not meet the clinical qualifications for the MLTCP.Review handbook and enrollment documents with applicants who meet the criteria for enrollment in the MLTCP.
